result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos M Bergin

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Carlos M Bergin in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Carlos M Bergin. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on October 7, 2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. 
 Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

2:05 PM Defendant Carlos M Bergin in court, in custody.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court further provides defendant with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
